en:
Hygieia (labelled), standing 3/4-view to the right, with her weight on
      her left leg, wearing a sleeved chiton, a himation pulled around her back and waist with her
      left hand, and raised above her shoulder with her left hand, a stephane, a beaded necklace,
      and two white bands on each wrist, hides her lowered head with a veil; Pandaisia (labelled),
      standing 3/4-view to the right, with her weight on her left leg, wearing a sleeved, belted
      chiton with shoulder straps, a sphendone (with a wreath?), black hoop earrings, and a black
      (?) band on each wrist, holds an olive branch to the right in her left hand, and a platter of
      fruit in her right hand; a nude Eros flies profile to the right, with his wings frontal,
      reaches his arms forward; Eudaimonia (labelled), seated on a rock 3/4-view to the left, with
      her head profile to the right, wearing a sleeved, belted chiton, a himation over her legs, a
      sphendone (with a wreath?), a beaded necklace, and a black band on her right wrist, holds a
      beaded necklace between her upraised left hand and her lowered right hand; a short olive tree;
      an olive wreath above; a youth, perhaps Polykles (labelled), standing near frontal, with his
      head profile to the left, wearing a chlamys down his back, bound in front of his neck, an
      olive wreath, and sandals, rests his left hand on his hip, and holds two spears in his
      upraised right hand; Kale (labelled), standing 3/4-view to the left, wearing a belted peplos,
      a high pony tail, bead earrings, a beaded necklace, and two bands on each wrist, holds a white
      thread with a white pendant at the end, in both hands, of which the right one is slightly
      raised, and the left one is at waist level, with the index finger pointing
      up.
